question: Find the integer $n,$ $-90 < n < 90,$ such that $\tan n^\circ = \tan 252^\circ.$
agents_response:
We know that $\tan (252^\circ) = \tan (252^\circ - 180^\circ) = \tan (-72^\circ).$

Since $\tan$ has a period of $180^\circ,$ $\tan (-72^\circ) = \tan (180^\circ - 72^\circ) = \tan 108^\circ.$

Since $\tan$ has a period of $180^\circ,$ $\tan 108^\circ = \tan (108^\circ - 180^\circ) = \tan (-72^\circ)$

Therefore, the integer $n$ such that $\tan n^\circ = \tan 252^\circ$ is $n = \boxed{-72}.$
